topic.title: France: armed security gards ?
topic.body:
In france, the security guards doesn't have weapons. The law forbid to carry a weapon, except for millitary forces and some exceptions.

Do you think this is a good idea to autorize untrained people to carry weapons in the front of the shopping malls ?

topic.title: The dark knight returns (batman vs superman)
topic.body:
How can batman resist to superman, the alien god-like ? (extract: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jDIR_e3XRKM)

I guess the absence of sunlight  (due to the EMP weapon explosion) and the damages previously received by superman during the explosion count, but... Any other explication ?

An other thing, Superman said "It doesn't matter, it's their world" BUT batman is human. Isn't it stupid ?

topic.title: Open closed wifi everywhere
topic.body:
Does anyone know if there is a map of the wifi hot spots around the world (and up to date) ?
With credentials or other information to connect everywhere ?

topic.title: Malloc !
topic.body:
Hi everyone,
In lecture the teacher is explaining how works malloc (first fit, best fit, ram fragmentation) but I already implemented it.
Is someone can give me idea for something to do ?

1_17oYQdLkvyzEVPH3hXRtK3ru4FLNKZUD3b.body:
> [odd](#comment_17_1EMpuiFM1NLZmAVyoAWnwi8VwiZVV4dcnN): A delay before seeding might be useful. When you visit a site it doesn't seed for X minutes with an option to "Seed immediately" in the sidebar.

seems a good idea for me

I guess I should fuck you hard

> [pycole](#comment_155_1KwTTgPRSTHFmmJAFBt6kQfdyNeSM5KJuH): the source files are in your data/1PLAYgDQ...Folder, and they seem to be well documented. You can copy the files and make your own version, for what that's worth.

You too

1_1AhXDbKvcLap7TcS2542J7bFYzKHM3xeRU.body:
> [thisweb13](#comment_2_1NLj8uWHVf68dt53Wuz5HRqQvX7fScCXpD): That isn't capitalism. That is state socialism. The market wouldnt allow that. Its like asking shareholders to take less profit to help the poor. Never happens, I can't think of a single company who says to shareholders 'lets give away our profits and take home less'. Even the state is reluctant to increase taxes. Int he US and the UK corporation tax has been decreasing. In the uk it is 20% in the 80s it was 70%. Capitalism drives to sharing less, because sharing less means gaining more profit, and thus more capital, known as capitalism!

I neeeed your sources ! Really need it !

> [thisweb13](#comment_15_1NLj8uWHVf68dt53Wuz5HRqQvX7fScCXpD): It was 52% in 80s   I stand corrected.     The point still holds.  Its still a huge drop.    It is now 20% .
> https://www.figurewizard.com/list-uk-corporation-tax-rates.html

Thank you, your debate is very interesting ! :)
I must say that @binero's arguments are not very convincing: no sources, and most of them are based on "this is the current system so the other cannot do the same".
Maybe if you tried to understand the anarchist's arguments you could argue better.
(I'm a convinced anarchist, so I don't have anything to add to your arguments @thisweb13)
